results.title: U.S. to Dispose of Emergency Food Supplies Meant for Crisis Zones
results.summary: The U.S. government is disposing of 500 tons of emergency food supplies due to nearing expiration, costing taxpayers $100,000. A former USAID official blamed the Trump administration for the decline in humanitarian logistics, stating, "These biscuits were the perfect aid for crises like Gaza. It's heartbreaking to see them go to waste." While the State Department justifies this as an unavoidable risk, experts raise concerns about inefficient resource utilization amid global food crises.
